p: The definition of “altered mentation” with regard to the qSOFA score has two versions in the literature. One includes a GCS score ≤ 13, which was mentioned in the original study of Sepsis-3 [ 23]. The other was a GCS score < 15, according to the definitions of sepsis and septic specified by the Third International Consensus [ 22]. In the present study, we used the GCS score < 15 for analysis. This might have caused an overestimated qSOFA score because of patients with unclear baseline mental status due to underlying disease.
